title: Failed to create CoreCLR, HRESULT: 0x80070008
body:
**Describe the bug**
A clear and concise description of what the bug is.
I am developer for dappnode and in the version [v1.13.2](https://github.com/NethermindEth/nethermind/releases/tag/1.13.2) I started to have this error message. It seems is something related to some dappnode environment configuration as docker version i think.The error not only happens if you install a dappnode package, it happens too if you execute the installation by docker manually in the same way you would do in a remote machine.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behaviour:
1. Go to your remote machine
2. Execute `docker run -it -p 8545:8545 nethermind/nethermind --JsonRpc.Enabled true --JsonRpc.Host 0.0.0.0`
4. See error
```
Unable to find image 'nethermind/nethermind:latest' locally
latest: Pulling from nethermind/nethermind
405f018f9d1d: Pull complete 
d9ee6baa6680: Pull complete 
65438e63aeb3: Pull complete 
fe88af44541b: Pull complete 
6980e1757920: Pull complete 
d5824a8a9d11: Pull complete 
9d29abfe2f57: Pull complete 
0ff4c8474983: Pull complete 
30b9c04fde26: Pull complete 
Digest: sha256:9f715ca1bdcc7b1d9e52f63e036be66a656e03113b9b00fdf94866c0098b46eb
Status: Downloaded newer image for nethermind/nethermind:latest
Failed to create CoreCLR, HRESULT: 0x80070008
```


**Expected behaviour**
The node should start.

**Screenshots**
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Linux dappnode 4.19.0-13-amd64 #1 SMP Debian 4.19.160-2 (2020-11-28) x86_64 GNU/Linux
 - docker Docker version 20.10.2, build 2291f61
 

**Additional context**
I have enough free memory in the machine, at least 2 TB, and this error does not happen in version 1.13.1 and previous ones.
Can you use the version tag explicitly `nethermind/nethermind:1.13.2` and run `docker image inspect nethermind/nethermind:1.13.2` to double check if we are looking at the same image?
Also, can you share your output for `docker info`?

If i use the specific tag 1.13.12 `docker run -it -p 8545:8545 nethermind/nethermind:1.13.2 --JsonRpc.Enabled true --JsonRpc.Host 0.0.0.0`
```
Unable to find image 'nethermind/nethermind:1.13.2' locally
1.13.2: Pulling from nethermind/nethermind
405f018f9d1d: Already exists 
7f5199084fb2: Pull complete 
ae2c6691208b: Pull complete 
114810c4073f: Pull complete 
465cec400a7f: Pull complete 
36e1fa11c54b: Pull complete 
f7d958416ff8: Pull complete 
aced9de0ae29: Pull complete 
8d29074600ee: Pull complete 
Digest: sha256:37f9d9efe980318bafd394216e1e0cb2c862f892bfa2004faac368642e4f1758
Status: Downloaded newer image for nethermind/nethermind:1.13.2
Failed to create CoreCLR, HRESULT: 0x80070008
```

Can you try this custom image? `nethermindeth/nethermind:asdacap-1132-test-debian`
There seems to be a potential issue with old docker and ubuntu jammy (which 1.13.2 switch to). https://www.linuxserver.io/blog/anatomy-of-an-issue, you may want to try to upgrade docker also.
I have tested that image and all works

Had the same issue and fixed it by upgrading docker ([https://docs.docker.com/engine/install/debian/](https://docs.docker.com/engine/install/debian/)). 
Didn't have to use your custom nethermind image.
Got it, that confirms it then. There is a compatibility issue with ubutntu 22.04 with old docker version. The docker will need to be upgraded.
